title: Strengthening Learning Design Practical Competencies: Integrating Nursing Theory and Practice Through Experienced Expert-Led Projects

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: The ability to apply nursing theories (e.g., infection control, patient assessment) to practical scenarios is evaluated through analysis of expert practitioners' real-world cases.

In a 4-week PBL team project, learners collaborate with an experienced expert (at least one nurse) to develop nursing intervention plans for two patient cases and propose solutions that meet at least four of five feasibility evaluation checklist items.

At the end of a 2-week mid-term course, learners demonstrate reflective and problem-solving abilities through a portfolio (three theory-practice linkage cases) and a 10-minute presentation (including one problem-solving process), achieving at least 4 points (on a 5-point scale) in four of five evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
